name: Private Enforcement Initiatives
popular_name: (FHIP PEI) United States Department of Housing and Urban Development - Office of Fair Housing and Equal Opportunity
objective: To assist private non-profit fair housing enforcement organizations in the investigation and enforcement of violations of the rights granted under title VIII of the Civil Rights Act of 1968 (42 U.S.C. 2801). To develop, implement, and carry out, related activities and enforcement under the Fair Housing Act or State or local laws that provide substantially equivalent rights and remedies for alleged discriminatory housing practices. Objectives include carrying out testing and other investigative activities.
top_agency_name: Department of Housing and Urban Development
sub_agency_name: Assistant Secretary for Fair Housing and Equal Opportunity
applicant_types: Public nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
